description: Dive into "Explore Sendai: Unforgettable Free Gems" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Explore Sendai: Unforgettable Free Gems

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Sendai, Tsutsujigaoka Park is a delightful urban oasis that comes alive each spring with stunning cherry blossoms. This park is not only a picturesque picnic spot but also features an array of modern sculptures that enhance its charm. Visitors can stroll along pathways lined with weeping cherry trees and the iconic Somei Yoshino variety, creating a breathtaking scene perfect for leisurely walks or photography.

sources.snippet: Tsutsujigaoka Park is a spacious public park known for its azalea blooms in the spring. It's a popular spot for locals to relax and enjoy outdoor activities. The park also features a baseball field, tennis courts, and a playground, making it a lively place for families and sports enthusiasts.
sources.shortName: 7 Free Things to Do in Sendai

sources.snippet: If you are planning to visit Sendai during spring (mid-March to early May), then you are in luck!. During this season, more than 360 cherry blossom trees are in bloom at Tsutsujigaoka Park in the eastern part of Sendai.
sources.shortName: 16 Things to Do in the Japan's City of Sendai

places.name: Tsutsujigaoka Park

reviews.text: This place is perfect to go as family or friends. And i think you can make this place your perfect dry picnic spot. It's wide and pretty all the way.

Beautiful park with lots of Cherry blossoms to catch! You have a wide variety of flowers to view here. Also buzzing with lots of life with the carnival stalls. Will recommend if looking to catch the cherry season in April.
満開 is on-going at the park right now. The park is filled with locals drinking, feasting and enjoying the full blooms.

places.address: 1 Chome-３０１-３外 Gorin, Miyagino Ward, Sendai, Miyagi 983-0842, Japan

places.generalDescription: Sendai Castle Honmaru Ruins, also known as Aoba Castle, was built in 1602 after Tokugawa Ieyasu's victory at the Battle of Sekigahara. Although it never had a main keep, it featured an impressive honmaru and multi-storied yagura. The castle town was divided into merchant and residential areas to the east and the castle to the west.

sources.snippet: Sendai Castle, which is also known as Aoba Castle, is the ruins of the former castle, occupying a prominent location on top of a hill in the western part of the city. The castle was built and founded by the famous feudal lord Date Masamune in 1610. A statue of Masamune riding a horse looking down to the city can be found at the entrance to the castle grounds, offering visitors nice views of the city.
sources.shortName: Sendai Travel Guide - 9 Best things to do in Sendai

sources.snippet: The Sendai Castle, also known as Aoba Castle, sits atop Mount Aoba and offers panoramic views of the city. While the castle itself no longer stands, the ruins and the surrounding park are a popular spot for history buffs and nature lovers alike. The site also features a statue of Date Masamune, the daimyo who founded Sendai, making it a significant cultural landmark.
sources.shortName: 7 Free Things to Do in Sendai

sources.snippet: 偉瑩出遊玩樂In April 2019, for the cherry blossoms in Shanghai, Tedeng is Japan to take a multi-way inland machine to Sendai, enjoy the cherry blossoms to eat Sendai famous cattle roasting tongue, this Xizhu are a few famous, cattle tongue has several series you pick, rich and frugal.

places.name: Sendai Castle Honmaru Ruins

reviews.text: A great place to come visit and explore the beauty of Japanese culture. There are shops selling souvenirs, food, and good luck charms.

Great view of the city of Sendai from up at the hill where the castle once stood. The only thing up here is the statue, shrine, and gift shops. The castle is no longer here, so I don't think tourists will miss much if they don't come here. Plus the trek up the hill can be tiring, unless you pay for the loople bus but it can be crowded and takes a long time to come.

Overpriced. Parking was expensive and the museum was really expensive for what is just a single room of exhibits and a video. The video was cute, and I liked the talking edamame, but not worth the price of admission. The gift shop is decent. The best part is the small recreated display room across from the statue of the horse. We almost missed it because it just looks like a bathroom. Don't make that mistake!

places.address: Kawauchi, Aoba Ward, Sendai, Miyagi 980-0862, Japan

places.generalDescription: Kotodai Park is a beloved public green space located in the heart of Sendai. It offers various amenities such as a concert hall, benches, a fountain, and even a helipad. The park is divided into three distinct zones: History Zone, Busy Zone, and Ikoi Zone. Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks and relaxation in this picturesque park.
places.name: Kotodai Park

reviews.text:
There are often events, live shows, or small concerts. A great place to relax in the city.
Calm atmosphere, lots of trees, and plenty of benches. Perfect for a lunch break or just chilling out.
We went here for the Sendai Jazz Festival Sept 9/10.  Great show.  Super good bands.  Fun strolling around with all the good trucks.
A great and spacious park where lots of events are regularly held. It is close to the Namboku line subway station (Kotodai Koen Station), hence making it very accessible.

places.address: 3 Chome Honcho, Aoba Ward, Sendai, Miyagi 980-0014, Japan
